alert.note: Alert for Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Fresno-Clovis (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 4:04PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fresno County through 445 PM PDT... At 403 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Easton, or 11 miles south of Fresno, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fresno, Clovis, Selma, Parlier, Bowles, Del Rey, Calwa, Easton, Raisin City, Fowler and Caruthers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
